name: Linguine With String Beans, Boiled Potatoes and Pesto
keywords: basil, pasta, string beans, main course, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese plus some to serve at the table
1/2 pound string beans, trimmed into 1 1/2-inch pieces
3 medium boiled potatoes, cut into slivers about 1 1/2 inches long

recipeInstructions.text: Put the basil, pine nuts, garlic, salt and pepper in a blender and mix at high speed. Scrape down the sides of the blender with a spatula and mix again. Slowly add the olive oil and blend until you have an emulsion. Pour the mixture into a bowl and by hand, fold in the Parmesan and pecorino cheeses.
Bring six quarts salted water to boil for the pasta. Steam the beans until they are cooked (about 10 to 15 minutes).
Cook the pasta until al dente. Drain and toss with the pesto sauce. Fold in the string beans and the potatoes. Correct seasoning and serve with grated Parmesan cheese passed separately.
